commit_message:
Use common.processutils.execute

This patch replaces the cinder.utils.execute method
with a wrapper around openstack.common.processutils.execute.

With the wrapper I'm also converting the processutils exceptions
to maintain compatability with the existing exceptions that are
caught/raised in the code.

Change-Id: Ibc36a1e83191e7c888ea62c55d28b7023535d9fa

fix-failed-migration flag, the server vm_state is set to 'resized' and
the server migration status is set to 'finished' so that the server
resize can be reverted

Implements: blueprint revert-resize-force-option

commit_message:
API to reset a db state of a migration

Extending the resetState action on servers, to fix failed migrations.
When a migration hangs or fails, the migration is recovered.
This API is called to reset the migration and instance states to mark the
migration as complete or to revert the migration.

DocImpact: When server action os-resetState action is called with
fix-failed-migration flag, the server vm_state is set to 'resized' and
the server migration status is set to 'finished' so that the server
resize can be reverted

Change-Id: Ia20ae3c4b34788d4ed3c44637a1fdde5ed24ff39
Implements: blueprint revert-resize-force-option

subject: Handle UnexpectedTaskState and InstanceNotFound exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-10 20:04:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': ' Handle UnexpectedTaskState and InstanceNotFound exceptions

    UnexpectedTaskState and InstanceNotFound are thrown when a delete of the
    instance happens before the ongoing action is completed.
    These are to be handled gracefully.
    These exceptions have to be logged and not reraised, as they are false
    alarms.

    Fixes: bug #1186447

    Change-Id: I0647935c4452d4294f49a4c0d08e480584ebec7c

Change-Id: Ic4451ecb6f21a738941a1f0399a688676400fed9
'}]
commit_message:
Handle UnexpectedTaskState and InstanceNotFound exceptions

    UnexpectedTaskState and InstanceNotFound are thrown when a delete of the
    instance happens before the ongoing action is completed.
    These are to be handled gracefully.
    These exceptions have to be logged and not reraised, as they are false
    alarms.

    Fixes: bug #1186447

    Change-Id: I0647935c4452d4294f49a4c0d08e480584ebec7c

Change-Id: Ic4451ecb6f21a738941a1f0399a688676400fed9

subject: Major restructuring of the exchange topology to solve leaky exchange issue.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-07 18:15:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py'], 'message': 'Major restructuring of the exchange topology to solve leaky exchange issue.

This also gets away from creating exchanges for all sort of htings.

The emphasis now is on AMQP 1.0 type addressing.  There is no need for lots
of exchanges.

This will also help simplify any federation that may be needed for federation.
The topology is now all under the amq.topic excahnge.

amq.topic/topic/sometopicHLQ.sometopicLLQ.etc.
amq.topic/direct/somedirectaddress
amq.topic/fanout/somefanoutname

Change-Id: I4ea49c0b89d7ed39dfa671cb1df57884dd0193c4
'}]
commit_message:
Major restructuring of the exchange topology to solve leaky exchange issue.

This also gets away from creating exchanges for all sort of htings.

The emphasis now is on AMQP 1.0 type addressing.  There is no need for lots
of exchanges.

This will also help simplify any federation that may be needed for federation.
The topology is now all under the amq.topic excahnge.

amq.topic/topic/sometopicHLQ.sometopicLLQ.etc.
amq.topic/direct/somedirectaddress
amq.topic/fanout/somefanoutname

Change-Id: I4ea49c0b89d7ed39dfa671cb1df57884dd0193c4

subject: engine : Add list_stack_actions RPC call
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-07 10:19:23.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_rpc_client.py', 'heat/rpc/client.py', 'heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/rpc/api.py', 'heat/engine/service.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_api_utils.py'], 'message': 'engine : Add list_stack_actions RPC call

Adds new RPC call which lists actions allowable for a stack
the only action initially included is stack_suspend, which
will be used in subsequent API and engine patches implementing
initial stack-suspend support

blueprint: stack-suspend-resume
Change-Id: I10c53ccacc514e555e45806e88a778462ad78ba6
'}]
commit_message:
engine : Add list_stack_actions RPC call

Adds new RPC call which lists actions allowable for a stack
the only action initially included is stack_suspend, which
will be used in subsequent API and engine patches implementing
initial stack-suspend support

blueprint: stack-suspend-resume

subject: Respect a user provided install-directory.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-08 05:45:04.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/packaging.py'], 'message': "Respect a user provided install-directory.

Previously when --root=X is given the easy install action
ignores this and attempts to install to /usr/lib/python2.6/
which errors out due to the easy install testing of where
it can write to. This is unexpected behavior when a user
provided user is given (since it should not be installing
in the system path if a different install directory is
provided).

This is affecting the running of `rpmbuild` since the rpmbuild
command expects to be able to assign a new root for its files
and then pbr doesn't respect that root location. This kills
the rpmbuild and any packages which use pbr from being able to
be correctly build by `rpmbuild -ba` (or similar).

Change-Id: I774a5c61d4c4a70133c876a6a5d841344728df2b
"}]
commit_message:
Respect a user provided install-directory.

Previously when --root=X is given the easy install action
ignores this and attempts to install to /usr/lib/python2.6/
which errors out due to the easy install testing of where
it can write to. This is unexpected behavior when a user
provided user is given (since it should not be installing
in the system path if a different install directory is
provided).

This is affecting the running of `rpmbuild` since the rpmbuild
command expects to be able to assign a new root for its files
and then pbr doesn't respect that root location. This kills
the rpmbuild and any packages which use pbr from being able to
be correctly build by `rpmbuild -ba` (or similar).

Change-Id: I774a5c61d4c4a70133c876a6a5d841344728df2b

subject: Fix InvalidContentType can't be raised because of error in constructor
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-06-18 06:03:03.000000000', 'files': ['quantumclient/common/exceptions.py', 'tests/unit/test_serializer.py'], 'message': "Fix InvalidContentType can't be raised because of error in constructor

InvalidContentType exception class is defined two times:
in quantumclient.openstack.common.exception and quantumclient.common.exceptions
with two different signatures.
A lot of code like Serializer.serialize() imports one of them but
attempts to use it with the signature of another one, which ends with
TypeError exception.

This change fixes the bug by removing the second definition of
InvalidContentType class and leaving only one which works correctly
with all code. Also adds unit tests.

Fixes bug #1131724

Change-Id: I4b9c40ccc77ec09678134e36a88f979eaa6fbfa8
"}]
commit_message:
Fix InvalidContentType can't be raised because of error in constructor

InvalidContentType exception class is defined two times:
in quantumclient.openstack.common.exception and quantumclient.common.exceptions
with two different signatures.
A lot of code like Serializer.serialize() imports one of them but
attempts to use it with the signature of another one, which ends with
TypeError exception.

This change fixes the bug by removing the second definition of
InvalidContentType class and leaving only one which works correctly
with all code. Also adds unit tests.

Fixes bug #1131724

Change-Id: I4b9c40ccc77ec09678134e36a88f979eaa6fbfa8

commit_message:
Boto no longer needs to be pinned to 2.5.2.

EC2 signing of v4 keys works fine, so newer boto will be fine. Meanwhile
this version of boto interferes with cloud-init 0.7.2.

Fixes bug #1180582

Change-Id: Ic298499c2e10cee6ddcaa5b2c3180ea4967fbd92

Make nova manage/baremetal-manage command output more helpful

The code contains following changes:

  exception catched.(nova-manage/nova-baremetal-manage)

  messages for debug.(nova-manage)
3.Add help messages for agent subcommand and logs subcommand.
  (nova-manage)

Fix bug: 1185902

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-13 05:52:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Allow confirm_resize if instance is in 'deleting' status

Deleting an instance puts it into 'deleting' task_state.
If the instance is in 'resized' vm_status, this tries a
confirm_resize on the instance. confirm_resize currently expects
the task_state to be None. It should instead expect
None/deleting task_state.

Fixes bug: 1189391

Change-Id: I6a3f82eab9ed2242bfd38bc1ac760dbb4b3d8c4a
"}]
commit_message:
Allow confirm_resize if instance is in 'deleting' status

Deleting an instance puts it into 'deleting' task_state.
If the instance is in 'resized' vm_status, this tries a
confirm_resize on the instance. confirm_resize currently expects
the task_state to be None. It should instead expect
None/deleting task_state.

Fixes bug: 1189391

Change-Id: I6a3f82eab9ed2242bfd38bc1ac760dbb4b3d8c4a

commit_message:
Add unique constraints to Cell.

In documentation: "name: Name of the current cell. This must be
unique for each cell"
Added unique constraint 'uniq_cell_name0deleted' ('name','deleted')
to Cell model and migrate sripts.
Added new exception `CellsExists`. Updated cell_create() in db.api.
Tests updated respectively.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ib76e167089cb4756e4438613b49013ebf0874afe

subject: Don't create /var/log/nova.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-17 21:37:51.000000000', 'files': ['elements/nova/os-config-applier/etc/nova/logging.conf', 'elements/nova/install.d/74-nova'], 'message': "Don't create /var/log/nova.

Since we are using upstart for logs we should not be creating
/var/log/nova/* since it will be empty and just cause confusion.

Don't create /var/log/nova upon install and disable watchedfile logging
handler, since we use upstart to record stdout, and using that handler
creates an empty /var/log/nova/nova.log.

Change-Id: Ic1c71f01c226ec9d29a74ad41a80a9d368833979
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create /var/log/nova.

Since we are using upstart for logs we should not be creating
/var/log/nova/* since it will be empty and just cause confusion.

Don't create /var/log/nova upon install and disable watchedfile logging
handler, since we use upstart to record stdout, and using that handler
creates an empty /var/log/nova/nova.log.

Change-Id: Ic1c71f01c226ec9d29a74ad41a80a9d368833979

commit_message:
Update requirements to fix devstack installation

Updating kombu to a newer version also requires a new anyjson
version. If we don't specify the versions here, some of the
other projects install older versions that don't work together
when running under devstack.

Fixes bug #1134575

Change-Id: Idcb45ca4b2c5d947b01a8b75f7906a3df6380ebe
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

subject: Http 400 when project enabled is not a boolean
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 6282, 'name': 'Wu Wenxiang', 'email': 'wu.wenxiang@99cloud.net', 'username': 'wu-wenxiang'}, {'_account_id': 6460, 'name': 'Brad Topol', 'email': 'btopol@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'btopol'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-15 21:24:18.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/core.py', 'tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'tests/test_backend.py', 'tests/test_content_types.py'], 'message': 'Http 400 when project enabled is not a boolean

Having enabled="true" in json data when updating tenant will produce 500

When updating a project, no type check was performed on the enabled
attribute. Therefore, if enabled value in JSON/XML is not a boolean but
a string, keystone responds with an incorrect Http 500 error code and
the stacktrace.

The change introduces a type validation of the enabled attribute at
identity manager. If the type is not a boolean, keystone now returns an
appropriate Http 400 error code with a message pointing a bad format for
the attribute.

Test cases have been added to file test_backend and test_content_types
for testing the case when enabled attribute is a string or int when
updating project.

Fixes bug #1191384

Change-Id: I86dd7e71d4bac1e3fd6fcabaa1a2136a47722e5f
'}]
commit_message:
Http 400 when project enabled is not a boolean

Having enabled="true" in json data when updating tenant will produce 500

When updating a project, no type check was performed on the enabled
attribute. Therefore, if enabled value in JSON/XML is not a boolean but
a string, keystone responds with an incorrect Http 500 error code and
the stacktrace.

The change introduces a type validation of the enabled attribute at
identity manager. If the type is not a boolean, keystone now returns an
appropriate Http 400 error code with a message pointing a bad format for
the attribute.

Test cases have been added to file test_backend and test_content_types
for testing the case when enabled attribute is a string or int when
updating project.

Fixes bug #1191384

Change-Id: I86dd7e71d4bac1e3fd6fcabaa1a2136a47722e5f

subject: Fix instance obj refresh()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-17 19:16:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_instance.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py'], 'message': "Fix instance obj refresh()

The refresh() method pulls a fresh copy of the instance but if any
fields changed when doing so, they are left marked as changes that
are not yet committed.

Also clarified the doc string for obj_what_changed() to state that a set
is returned, not a list.

This method is not used yet, so I didn't file a bug for this.

Change-Id: I83fbce07936fea2bc936441c5c6594f65da443a7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance obj refresh()

The refresh() method pulls a fresh copy of the instance but if any
fields changed when doing so, they are left marked as changes that
are not yet committed.

Also clarified the doc string for obj_what_changed() to state that a set
is returned, not a list.

This method is not used yet, so I didn't file a bug for this.

Change-Id: I83fbce07936fea2bc936441c5c6594f65da443a7

subject: Fix overzealous conductor test for vol_usage_update
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6969, 'name': 'Michael Kerrin', 'email': 'michael.kerrin@hpe.com', 'username': 'mkerrin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-17 16:46:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/conductor/test_conductor.py'], 'message': "Fix overzealous conductor test for vol_usage_update

The rest of the conductor tests are pretty unit-esque, in that
they don't test the underlying functionality. Rather, they confirm
that the various conductor APIs (public, local, rpc, and manger)
all agree and that the plumbing between them works as expected.

The test_vol_usage_update() test does too much, and as a result,
gets all twisted in how it mucks with mox to stub out utcnow()
without breaking the base test harness. Unfortunately, it seems
to fail quite often, depending on testr ordering, and has been
blocking the gate quite a bit lately.

This patch refactors that test to be like all the rest of the
conductor tests. It also removes the useless mirror test of
test_vol_usage_update_again().

Fixes bug 1190971

Change-Id: I815b25f6585786a8dbd5eefcfb39e2b4790641cb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix overzealous conductor test for vol_usage_update

The rest of the conductor tests are pretty unit-esque, in that
they don't test the underlying functionality. Rather, they confirm
that the various conductor APIs (public, local, rpc, and manger)
all agree and that the plumbing between them works as expected.

The test_vol_usage_update() test does too much, and as a result,
gets all twisted in how it mucks with mox to stub out utcnow()
without breaking the base test harness. Unfortunately, it seems
to fail quite often, depending on testr ordering, and has been
blocking the gate quite a bit lately.

This patch refactors that test to be like all the rest of the
conductor tests. It also removes the useless mirror test of
test_vol_usage_update_again().

Fixes bug 1190971

Change-Id: I815b25f6585786a8dbd5eefcfb39e2b4790641cb

commit_message:
python3: Fix traceback while running tests.

Fix:

TypeError: Unicode-objects must be encoded before hashing

while running tests. This is due to the fact in python3 hashlib.md5
works with bytes and we are passing unicode strings.

Change-Id: I0adde942423af28572473030f6685e12cd8f7dae
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Added some de-facto style guidelines to HACKING and fixed violations

This patch adds several guidelines:

* Global constants should be ALL_CAPS (cfg => CFG)
* Prefer single-quotes over double-quotes ("foo" => 'foo')
* Place a space before TODO in comments ("#TODO" => "# TODO")

Change-Id: Ib5b5c5916744856eca2ecaa37e949a3cdc4b3bd7

commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible except construct

Python 3.x removed the "except x,y:" construct. Use
"except x as y:" instead which works with all
Python versions >= 2.6.

subject: Fix nova-compute fails to start if quantum is down
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-12 19:54:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix nova-compute fails to start if quantum is down

When nova-compute starts it needs to check the state of instances that
were previously running and needs to query quantum. Previously, if
it queried quantum and quantum raised an error or was unreachable
nova-compute would terminate. This patch adds a retry loop to prevent
this from happening.

Fixes bug 1186357

Change-Id: I0d865e464f7bf60a0b6dc4ca8a42436d16e29790
(cherry picked from commit 6fda12bb14ab91592910f9ebbde9ef9f8d588b08)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-compute fails to start if quantum is down

When nova-compute starts it needs to check the state of instances that
were previously running and needs to query quantum. Previously, if
it queried quantum and quantum raised an error or was unreachable
nova-compute would terminate. This patch adds a retry loop to prevent
this from happening.

Fixes bug 1186357

Change-Id: I0d865e464f7bf60a0b6dc4ca8a42436d16e29790
(cherry picked from commit 6fda12bb14ab91592910f9ebbde9ef9f8d588b08)

subject: python3: Fix import compatibility.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-15 23:27:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v1/volume_snapshots.py', 'cinderclient/v1/volumes.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volumes.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volume_snapshots.py'], 'message': 'python3: Fix import compatibility.

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so do it the old
fashioned way.

Change-Id: Idfb4f8eb538dcc98a1f7befc4487635d7f483973
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
python3: Fix import compatibility.

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urlparse, urllib2, etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so do it the old
fashioned way.

Change-Id: Idfb4f8eb538dcc98a1f7befc4487635d7f483973
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Move glance image service client from nova and cinder into python-glanceclient.

This is now present in nova and cinder, and it will be also needed in ironic,
so moving it into a common location.

Most of the code was present on nova.image.glance and cincer.image.glance.

glanceclient/exc.py => nova.exception <=> cinder.exception
 GlanceBaseException
 GlanceConnectionFailed
 ImageNotFound
 ImageNotAuthorized
 Invalid

tests/utils.py => nova.test <=> cinder.test
 BaseTestCase

tests/image/matchers.py => nova.tests.matchers
 DictKeysMismatch
 DictMismatch
 DictMatches

tests/unit/image/stubs.py => nova.tests.glance
tests/unit/image/test_glance.py => nova.tests.image

Added new modules from openstack-common:
 jsonutils
 fixture
 context

Change-Id: Ic387e5e76527a39a72bb4443aecc80fb02639d8f

commit_message:
Editable default quota support for cinder

Implement blueprint edit-default-quota

DocImpact

Using the class quotas named `default` as the default editable quotas.

We can use the following cinderclient command to update default quota:

cinder quota-class-update default <key> <value>

Change-Id: I9f97506b41157066026dd43163ec4b1827d5b9cf

subject: Remove redundant architecture property update in powervm snapshot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-11 17:33:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/powervm/test_powervm.py', 'nova/virt/powervm/driver.py'], 'message': 'Remove redundant architecture property update in powervm snapshot

During an instance snapshot if the architecture property is defined
in the image it is updated twice in the snapshot image.
The snapshot is created with the metadata values from the
"instance_system_metadata" table and then, if defined, the architecture
property is updated from the value in the base image in that moment.

There is no reason to treat this property differently from others.
Also, it didn't respect the "non_inheritable_image_properties" option.

This change removes the special behavior for the architecture property
in the powervm driver during a snapshot.

Fixes bug 1189969

Change-Id: I05ebcaef7b75387827917b5b223868794d98e0aa
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant architecture property update in powervm snapshot

During an instance snapshot if the architecture property is defined
in the image it is updated twice in the snapshot image.
The snapshot is created with the metadata values from the
"instance_system_metadata" table and then, if defined, the architecture
property is updated from the value in the base image in that moment.

There is no reason to treat this property differently from others.
Also, it didn't respect the "non_inheritable_image_properties" option.

This change removes the special behavior for the architecture property
in the powervm driver during a snapshot.

Fixes bug 1189969

Change-Id: I05ebcaef7b75387827917b5b223868794d98e0aa

subject: Fix systemd services.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-17 17:00:04.000000000', 'files': ['elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-daemon', 'elements/os-refresh-config/install.d/01-os-refresh-config', 'elements/nova-compute/install.d/80-nova-compute'], 'message': 'Fix systemd services.

Systemd services should be created at /lib/systemd/system instead of
/etc/systemd/system, once the service is enabled systemd will create a
link from /lib/systemd... to /etc/systemd...

Also systemd services should contain the absolute path to the executables.

Change-Id: I741fe249de8ecc7b2af100ca6cf55c51f86f84b0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix systemd services.

Systemd services should be created at /lib/systemd/system instead of
/etc/systemd/system, once the service is enabled systemd will create a
link from /lib/systemd... to /etc/systemd...

Also systemd services should contain the absolute path to the executables.

Change-Id: I741fe249de8ecc7b2af100ca6cf55c51f86f84b0

commit_message:
Migrate each instances of a host to another.

Added a new extension that adds the ability for admins to migrate all
servers of a host to another available hosts.

Implements blueprint host-servers-migrate

subject: Remove superfluous sf_volume_id reassignment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-07 03:32:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "Remove superfluous sf_volume_id reassignment

sf_volume_id was being reassigned after a new API call introduced
by a backported fix. This new API call (ModifyVolume) does not
contain the volumeID in its result.

Cloning a volume wasn't possible anymore due to a thrown error:
  KeyError: 'volumeID'

Removing the superfluous reassignment fixes the problem: sf_volume_id
is already assigned with the correct value.

Fixes: bug #1188454
Change-Id: I75196fc68666f28ac6222f43ea2ca6089b782f3f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove superfluous sf_volume_id reassignment

sf_volume_id was being reassigned after a new API call introduced
by a backported fix. This new API call (ModifyVolume) does not
contain the volumeID in its result.

Cloning a volume wasn't possible anymore due to a thrown error:
  KeyError: 'volumeID'

Removing the superfluous reassignment fixes the problem: sf_volume_id
is already assigned with the correct value.

Fixes: bug #1188454
Change-Id: I75196fc68666f28ac6222f43ea2ca6089b782f3f

subject: Fix bizarre Swift DeletionPolicy unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-17 10:31:14.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_s3.py', 'heat/tests/test_swift.py'], 'message': "Fix bizarre Swift DeletionPolicy unit tests

If something shouldn't be called... don't tell the mocks to expect it to be
called. We will get UnexpectedMethodCallError if it is.

Change-Id: I61a7b77cb273b42177a37efa98fc62fd69770545
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bizarre Swift DeletionPolicy unit tests

If something shouldn't be called... don't tell the mocks to expect it to be
called. We will get UnexpectedMethodCallError if it is.

Change-Id: I61a7b77cb273b42177a37efa98fc62fd69770545

commit_message:
Use physical_resource_name() for Swift containers

This returns names which are of the same form, but which are based on the
resource id (and hence are stable).

Change-Id: Id091bdef74e07fc0df0e6e4914dae8af8b29384c

subject: Use physical resource names with a short_id
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-17 10:31:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/utils.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Use physical resource names with a short_id

The short_id is a random, but stable, 12-character alphanumeric ID.

This will allow two resources of the same name to exist concurrently. That
is necessary for resources to be replaced during an update without
interruption.

Change-Id: If32904a47c6f8fb651e317ce91f2a04f6eadcc0b
'}]
commit_message:
Use physical resource names with a short_id

The short_id is a random, but stable, 12-character alphanumeric ID.

This will allow two resources of the same name to exist concurrently. That
is necessary for resources to be replaced during an update without
interruption.

Change-Id: If32904a47c6f8fb651e317ce91f2a04f6eadcc0b

subject: Correct preformatted text rendering in RST
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-09 17:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['openshift-origin/README.rst'], 'message': 'Correct preformatted text rendering in RST

Without the previous paragraph ending in ::, restructured text rendering
will run the lines into each other for the diskimage-builder
instructions.

This change introduces an additional : at the end of the previous
paragraph to force the following text to pre-formatted rendering.

Change-Id: I38cce42e623bc9121d29cc3583eed662666ec686
'}]
commit_message:
Correct preformatted text rendering in RST

Without the previous paragraph ending in ::, restructured text rendering
will run the lines into each other for the diskimage-builder
instructions.

This change introduces an additional : at the end of the previous
paragraph to force the following text to pre-formatted rendering.

Change-Id: I38cce42e623bc9121d29cc3583eed662666ec686

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-06-04 09:07:25.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/base.py', 'tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Add a fixture for using of SQLite in-memory DB.

Currently, SQLite DB in a file is used for testing of DB related
code. Thus, in each test case we have to ensure that tearDown()
drops all created tables, etc. It is much easier and cleaner to
guarantee that DB is in the original state by creating it in
memory instead.

Change-Id: I6f0a9735a0fb31bef30842afff50c6089fa2bf92
'}]
commit_message:
Add a fixture for using of SQLite in-memory DB.

Currently, SQLite DB in a file is used for testing of DB related
code. Thus, in each test case we have to ensure that tearDown()
drops all created tables, etc. It is much easier and cleaner to
guarantee that DB is in the original state by creating it in
memory instead.

Change-Id: I6f0a9735a0fb31bef30842afff50c6089fa2bf92

subject: Add auth_admin_prefix and custom auth_uri params
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-06-05 18:51:19.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/proxy/authtoken.pp', 'spec/classes/swift_proxy_authtoken_spec.rb', 'templates/proxy/authtoken.conf.erb'], 'message': "Add auth_admin_prefix and custom auth_uri params

auth_admin_prefix allows the prepend of a prefix to the URL used for
admin tasks.  See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7156/ for
implementation in Keystone.

auth_uri allows to specify the public authentication url (Keystone's
public endpoint) if it can't be guessed from $auth_host + $auth_protocol

Implements blueprint serve-keystone-from-wsgi

Change-Id: Ic66727f78406d70b5ab5bc07fcc074477df2303c
"}]
commit_message:
Add auth_admin_prefix and custom auth_uri params

auth_admin_prefix allows the prepend of a prefix to the URL used for
admin tasks.  See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7156/ for
implementation in Keystone.

auth_uri allows to specify the public authentication url (Keystone's
public endpoint) if it can't be guessed from $auth_host + $auth_protocol

Implements blueprint serve-keystone-from-wsgi

Change-Id: Ic66727f78406d70b5ab5bc07fcc074477df2303c

commit_message:
Replace publisher name by URL

This allows to specify any amount of configuration option for each
publisher in each pipeline. UDP is the first to use this to possibly
publish to differents (host, port).

Blueprint: pipeline-publisher-url

Change-Id: I6a6f53ff438395c7bbbafad30efe097e1e01e1c6
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Stop passing path to VerifiedHTTPSConnection

This class doesn't expect this argument.  Passing the argument causes the
client to break on all HTTPS connections.

Change-Id: I56f02b3a8943ff9a8b9e7855796fd527683514f3
Fixes: bug #1190111

subject: deploy element: Call find_disk in loop w/ timeout.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-16 22:08:29.000000000', 'files': ['elements/deploy/init'], 'message': 'deploy element: Call find_disk in loop w/ timeout.

Updates our deploy element's init script so that it calls
find_disk in a loop until it returns true (meaning we have a disk).

Previously on some bare metal machines find_disk would return ""
which causes the subsequent iscsi target commands to fail due to
a bad backing store.

This commit also updates the error message when start_iscsi_target
fails to be a bit more accurate as well.

Fixes LP Bug #1190984.

Change-Id: I3cd535d6672c197c1c3c539c83bba36be7a14e18
'}]
commit_message:
deploy element: Call find_disk in loop w/ timeout.

Updates our deploy element's init script so that it calls
find_disk in a loop until it returns true (meaning we have a disk).

Previously on some bare metal machines find_disk would return ""
which causes the subsequent iscsi target commands to fail due to
a bad backing store.

This commit also updates the error message when start_iscsi_target
fails to be a bit more accurate as well.

Fixes LP Bug #1190984.

Change-Id: I3cd535d6672c197c1c3c539c83bba36be7a14e18

commit_message:
Rename os-config-applier to os-apply-config.

This is being done to reduce confusion between os-refresh-config and
os-config-applier. In order to make the transition smooth, all this
patch does is rename the element, install the now pypi available
os-apply-config, and support both the old and new directory names
for templates, allowing incremental migration of users.

Change-Id: I8c4c7679799f4e8b436ce766791f45f4c81d75f2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-16 21:19:26.000000000', 'files': ['elements/nova/pre-install.d/00-disable-requiretty'], 'message': 'Allows nova user to sudo without a tty.

Some distros have the requiretty enabled by default in the /etc/sudoers.
The nova user tries to run `sudo nova-rootwrap` without a tty causing
the command to fail.

Change-Id: I484652d16ff168b96ca9896669209a34043c4d57
'}]
commit_message:
Allows nova user to sudo without a tty.

Some distros have the requiretty enabled by default in the /etc/sudoers.
The nova user tries to run `sudo nova-rootwrap` without a tty causing
the command to fail.

Change-Id: I484652d16ff168b96ca9896669209a34043c4d57

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-16 16:00:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp_lefthand.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/solaris.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_smis_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/zadara.py'], 'message': 'Remove usage of locals() for formatting from cinder.volume.*

Using of locals() for formatting string is a nasty thing because:
1) It is not so clear as using explicit dicts
2) It could produce hidden errors during refactoring
3) Changing name of variable causes change in message
4) Creating a lot of unused variables

Fix bug 1171936

Change-Id: I806c530851527db9da251352be45b97c183241a8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove usage of locals() for formatting from cinder.volume.*

Using of locals() for formatting string is a nasty thing because:
1) It is not so clear as using explicit dicts
2) It could produce hidden errors during refactoring
3) Changing name of variable causes change in message
4) Creating a lot of unused variables

Fix bug 1171936

Change-Id: I806c530851527db9da251352be45b97c183241a8

subject: Remove the 'migrate' option from cinder-manage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-14 23:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['bin/cinder-manage'], 'message': "Remove the 'migrate' option from cinder-manage

The 'migrate' option was only appropriate for use migrating
databases for volumes from Nova-Folsom-->Cinder-Folsom.  The
code hasn't been tested since.

Given the above facts, this commit removes the migrate code from
cinder-manage.  The man page for cinder-manage was already
updated to remove the option in a previous commit.

(fixes bug #1187134)

Change-Id: I7bf378cd4b0dd4f6d1bdf475b826a59a31112638
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the 'migrate' option from cinder-manage

The 'migrate' option was only appropriate for use migrating
databases for volumes from Nova-Folsom-->Cinder-Folsom.  The
code hasn't been tested since.

Given the above facts, this commit removes the migrate code from
cinder-manage.  The man page for cinder-manage was already
updated to remove the option in a previous commit.

(fixes bug #1187134)

Change-Id: I7bf378cd4b0dd4f6d1bdf475b826a59a31112638

set default for gw conn info in nvp_networkgw extension

Bug 1183285

This patch simply guarantees default segmentation type and
id in gateway connection info for the 'connect' and 'disconnect'
actions are correctly set respectively to 'flat' and 0.

First step in decoupling action/status in Resource

This adjusts the Event DB columns, model and class to split
action/status, but in order to be backwards compatible we set the action
to None, which means we can do the right thing in the CFN API, and
resource_status still maps correctly to what is expected in

commit_message:
Convert Events to separate action/status

First step in decoupling action/status in Resource

This adjusts the Event DB columns, model and class to split
action/status, but in order to be backwards compatible we set the action
to None, which means we can do the right thing in the CFN API, and
resource_status still maps correctly to what is expected in
python-heatclient (which will need to change after the Resource
action/status split happens)

Change-Id: I261d47d2a3fdb3cdc2a8aaf6c159763f4636f633

commit_message:
Add datetime utils

Add iso2timestamp and timestamp2iso which could change format of
datetime into ISO 8601 or timestamp. Those will be useful for
x-delete-at header or modified time and so on.

subject: Http 400 when project enabled is not a boolean
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6282, 'name': 'Wu Wenxiang', 'email': 'wu.wenxiang@99cloud.net', 'username': 'wu-wenxiang'}, {'_account_id': 6456, 'name': 'Sahdev Zala', 'email': 'spzala@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'spzala'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-06-14 15:22:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/core.py', 'tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/kvs.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/identity/controllers.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap/core.py', 'tests/test_backend.py', 'tests/test_content_types.py'], 'message': 'Http 400 when project enabled is not a boolean

Having enabled="true" in json data when creating tenant will produce 500

When creating or updating a project, no type check was performed on the
enabled attribute. Therefore, if enabled value in JSON/XML is not a
boolean but a string or an int, keystone responds with an incorrect Http
500 error code and the stacktrace.

The change introduces a type validation of the enabled attribute at
backend and api layer. If the type is not a boolean, keystone now
returns an appropriate Http 400 error code with a message pointing a bad
format for the attribute.

Test cases have been added to file test_backend and test_content_types
for testing the case when enabled attribute is a string or int when
creating or updating project.

The same correction can be done for creating/updating domains.

Fixes bug #1189528

Change-Id: Ic902824ba7d21bf09e5aebc8452c89c192d77ef3
'}]
commit_message:
Http 400 when project enabled is not a boolean

Having enabled="true" in json data when creating tenant will produce 500

When creating or updating a project, no type check was performed on the
enabled attribute. Therefore, if enabled value in JSON/XML is not a
boolean but a string or an int, keystone responds with an incorrect Http
500 error code and the stacktrace.

The change introduces a type validation of the enabled attribute at
backend and api layer. If the type is not a boolean, keystone now
returns an appropriate Http 400 error code with a message pointing a bad
format for the attribute.

Test cases have been added to file test_backend and test_content_types
for testing the case when enabled attribute is a string or int when
creating or updating project.

The same correction can be done for creating/updating domains.

Fixes bug #1189528

Change-Id: Ic902824ba7d21bf09e5aebc8452c89c192d77ef3

commit_message:
Some libvirt driver lookups lacks proper exception handling

Add error handling to list_instance_uuids() and get_memory_mb_used().
While fixing list_instance_uuids, this change also removes an
unnecessary extra lookup for every running instance.

Improve test coverage for list_instances() and list_instance_uuids().

Change-Id: I0cabe5f38d19143a3eb7b2ebce1ea6ea63f36929

subject: Quantum API _get_floating_ip_by_address mismatch with Nova-Net
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-12 15:13:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/quantumv2/api.py'], 'message': 'Quantum API _get_floating_ip_by_address mismatch with Nova-Net

_get_floating_ip_by_address() has a unspecified behavior when
IP address is empty and only one floating IP is allocated in
the pool. It should return a 404 Not found like Nova-Net does
but instead returns the only IP in the pool.

Fix bug #1190242

Change-Id: Id4843edda8e66ccabab5e9d053c595a1cd247770
'}]
commit_message:
Quantum API _get_floating_ip_by_address mismatch with Nova-Net

_get_floating_ip_by_address() has a unspecified behavior when
IP address is empty and only one floating IP is allocated in
the pool. It should return a 404 Not found like Nova-Net does
but instead returns the only IP in the pool.

Fix bug #1190242

Change-Id: Id4843edda8e66ccabab5e9d053c595a1cd247770

subject: Fix bad vm_state change in reboot_instance()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1711, 'name': 'Yun Mao', 'email': 'yunmao@gmail.com', 'username': 'yunmao'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-14 19:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Fix bad vm_state change in reboot_instance()

Currently reboot_instance() in the compute manager
changes the vm_state to active before it does anything
else. This means that if there is an error in the reboot
operation then the vm_state is left as active although
the instance may not be running.

This change leaves the vm_state alone until the reboot
has completed

If the reboot fails but the power_state shows that it
is running then we log the fault but leave it in an
active or rescued state

If the reboot fails and the power_state shows that it
is not running then we set vm_state to error

See also https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1183946
which make recovery from an Error state possible.

Fixes bug: 1188343

Change-Id: Idabd358d3bcaf63e21ff59188f805143dbaf9ada
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bad vm_state change in reboot_instance()

Currently reboot_instance() in the compute manager
changes the vm_state to active before it does anything
else. This means that if there is an error in the reboot
operation then the vm_state is left as active although
the instance may not be running.

This change leaves the vm_state alone until the reboot
has completed

If the reboot fails but the power_state shows that it
is running then we log the fault but leave it in an
active or rescued state

If the reboot fails and the power_state shows that it
is not running then we set vm_state to error

See also https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1183946
which make recovery from an Error state possible.

Fixes bug: 1188343

Change-Id: Idabd358d3bcaf63e21ff59188f805143dbaf9ada

commit_message:
Don't make nova-compute depend on iSCSI

Because not all volume drivers require iSCSI it makes sense to not
set the initiator in the connector and let the volume drivers
return an error if iSCSI is required.

bug #1007084

Change-Id: I5da472e5013fdc0c733ecb12b919c1068873bdc6

addressing python conventions.

commit_message:
Fix to disallow server name with all blank spaces

* Nova CLI allows server name to be created with all blank characters.
  This fix will disallow a server name with all blank spaces during
  server/instance creation as well as while updating/renaming a server
* Adding unit tests to test the above scenarios (create & rename
  server with blank spaces)

Fixes bug 1175956

Change-Id: I58af207c4a6b8579bb172d4bb612e0aa2aa6b498

subject: NetApp unified driver implementation.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-06-13 14:10:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_drivers_compatibility.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp_nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/options.py'], 'message': 'NetApp unified driver implementation.

NetApp has growing number of multiple drivers depending on storage families
and technologies. NetApp unified driver simplifies configuration
and provides single entry point for all storage technologies/drivers.
It provides pluggable mechanism to support multiple NetApp technologies
and block drivers related to them. Deprecated 7mode dfm and c mode
webservice based drivers.

blueprint netapp-unified-driver

Change-Id: If7a9923ea02f650cea8a700003ba9438a2b92cab
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp unified driver implementation.

NetApp has growing number of multiple drivers depending on storage families
and technologies. NetApp unified driver simplifies configuration
and provides single entry point for all storage technologies/drivers.
It provides pluggable mechanism to support multiple NetApp technologies
and block drivers related to them. Deprecated 7mode dfm and c mode
webservice based drivers.

blueprint netapp-unified-driver

Change-Id: If7a9923ea02f650cea8a700003ba9438a2b92cab

The Nicira plugin does not require an L3 agent, however the
PUBLIC_BRIDGE is needed by the quantum-debug tool as well as

Change-Id: Ie60f8f340e034a35a65e54518838c1d751a481a8

commit_message:
quantum-debug configuration fails on missing PUBLIC_BRIDGE

The Nicira plugin does not require an L3 agent, however the
PUBLIC_BRIDGE is needed by the quantum-debug tool as well as
nicira third_party configuration.

Fixes bug #1190062

Change-Id: Ie60f8f340e034a35a65e54518838c1d751a481a8

commit_message:
Raise exception if --nic is specified w/out net-id

When specifying --nic, net-id (UUID) needs to be specified.  This
change ensures that both net-id is provided and that all specified
keys are valid.

Change-Id: I9278a8f76d4e9972bb07fbf41b7973e906f57ba9
Fixes: bug #1191139

subject: Raise BadRequest if unable to create subnet
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-12 21:13:42.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/base.py'], 'message': 'Raise BadRequest if unable to create subnet

The existing create_subnet method iterates over subnets looking for one
that it can use and filters out any errors for overlapping CIDRs. The
problem is if a usable subnet is not found, the code goes on to use an
undeclared variable (body).

This patch saves the last overlapping CIDR exception and raises it if no
usable subnet is found to avoid the undeclared variable usage.

Fixes bug 1186445

Change-Id: I9ba4feada05a65a592bbd04ce8b722200e80b165
'}]
commit_message:
Raise BadRequest if unable to create subnet

The existing create_subnet method iterates over subnets looking for one
that it can use and filters out any errors for overlapping CIDRs. The
problem is if a usable subnet is not found, the code goes on to use an
undeclared variable (body).

This patch saves the last overlapping CIDR exception and raises it if no
usable subnet is found to avoid the undeclared variable usage.

Fixes bug 1186445

Change-Id: I9ba4feada05a65a592bbd04ce8b722200e80b165

commit_message:
Add new libvirt_scrub_logical_volume option

For less security conscious setups, or performance sensitive setups, add
this new option to make it configurable whether to scrub logical volume
or not when deleting the lvm disk.

Change-Id: Ic2722e1d6b5784d7b65f476312d230ee1ed30d93

commit_message:
translates empty remote_ip_prefix to valid cidr for nova

Quantum allows empty remote_ip_prefix to mean "any host"
but Nova uses a CIDR as part of each rule.

Fixes bug 1180828

Change-Id: I4983515ccd0cc621491d63e59d6ab6ac4dd74b6a

subject: Don't snat all traffic when force_snat_range set
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 191, 'name': 'Trey Morris', 'email': 'trey.morris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'tr3buchet'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-06-04 20:57:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_manager.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_linux_net.py'], 'message': "Don't snat all traffic when force_snat_range set

When using /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables=1, bridged
traffic gets snatted even though it is being bridged out to an
external gateway. This can lead to asymmetric routes where traffic
goes out the fixed network and comes back on the float network
and can lead to packets being blocked by firewalls. Work around
this problem by only fallback snatting when the traffic is
going to one of the force_snat_ranges. If force_snat_range is not
set it defaults to the existing behavior of snatting all traffic
that doesn't hit an earlier rule.

Fixes bug 1182143

Change-Id: If496dad2308a68a6a4a9fd43d695943bc5034ac4
"}]
commit_message:
Don't snat all traffic when force_snat_range set

When using /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables=1, bridged
traffic gets snatted even though it is being bridged out to an
external gateway. This can lead to asymmetric routes where traffic
goes out the fixed network and comes back on the float network
and can lead to packets being blocked by firewalls. Work around
this problem by only fallback snatting when the traffic is
going to one of the force_snat_ranges. If force_snat_range is not
set it defaults to the existing behavior of snatting all traffic
that doesn't hit an earlier rule.

Fixes bug 1182143

Change-Id: If496dad2308a68a6a4a9fd43d695943bc5034ac4

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-06-15 00:06:03.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "override tempest http_image variable in the gate

one of the tempest tests is to ensure glance can download something
over http, defaulting to the upstream cirros image. In the gate
that url ends up unstable on the network.

To get around this, feed devstack a tempest variable which sets
this to the horizon url. That's a valid http url. Because we don't
test for content, this is good enough for the test.

Rev 2: hardcode horizon to 127.0.0.1, the previous variable wasn't
set.

Partial fix for bug #1190623 once the devstack change lands.

Change-Id: Ifd94ace4b07a5ab9d20af7088e38420e9f3aab88
"}]
commit_message:
override tempest http_image variable in the gate

one of the tempest tests is to ensure glance can download something
over http, defaulting to the upstream cirros image. In the gate
that url ends up unstable on the network.

To get around this, feed devstack a tempest variable which sets
this to the horizon url. That's a valid http url. Because we don't
test for content, this is good enough for the test.

Rev 2: hardcode horizon to 127.0.0.1, the previous variable wasn't
set.

Partial fix for bug #1190623 once the devstack change lands.

Change-Id: Ifd94ace4b07a5ab9d20af7088e38420e9f3aab88

commit_message:
api: Add initial support for an actions subpath

Initial support for an actions subpath, which will be the access-point
for non-lifecycle operations on stacks, e.g suspend/resume
The API interface is similar to the Server Admin Actions nova extension
which will be the primary underlying interface used for this functionality

Change-Id: If8ac7145c77b0f26779d9e9d4c50854003554546

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-07 12:51:15.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/libvirt.rb'], 'message': "Redhat family doesn't have dbus service

The dbus service in RHEL, CentOS and Fedora is called messagebus,
which causes the libvirt.rb recipe to fail. This fixes that.

Change-Id: I0216569c0fa91c5d2dfcea4cabc942bd9f2441dc

commit_message:
Redhat family doesn't have dbus service

The dbus service in RHEL, CentOS and Fedora is called messagebus,
which causes the libvirt.rb recipe to fail. This fixes that.

Change-Id: I0216569c0fa91c5d2dfcea4cabc942bd9f2441dc

commit_message:
Retry failed deletes.

Operators report that deleting instance files from NFS sometimes fails.
This review implements a simple retry periodic task which attempts to
delete these files several times before giving up.

Resolves bug 1040110.

Change-Id: I465be6421633e22e3185b3b5eec1d037ae2e6d54

metadata-like "extra" field.

commit_message:
Implement a simple local store.

This store is deliberately unstructured. It is up to the user to handle
versioning and so forth. In the use cases I can think of, its just a
list, so shouldn't require much work.

It doesn't make sense to store this data in the central nova DB,
because if you lose the disks on a compute node, this store is
intended for work which would no longer be required.

Change-Id: I4c49a0f3e7e0039649b8eb80718aae67c78e10d8

commit_message:
Add GroupEvenSpreadWeigher for nova scheduler

GroupEvenSpreadWeigher allows to spread instances from definite
group between all accessible hosts. It is necessary to pass a
scheduler hint, using group as key and name of the group as value,
when booting an instance.

Add tests for this weigher.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint add-group-even-spread-weigher

Change-Id: I35d56c791111c2f44a22c69a7a543b9c0d5f3612

subject: Using sql as default driver for tokens
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-06-14 00:08:22.000000000', 'files': ['etc/keystone.conf.sample', 'keystone/common/config.py', 'tests/test_overrides.conf'], 'message': 'Using sql as default driver for tokens

kvs driver for tokens is not a production quality storage method.
The shortcomings of using kvs as storage driver for tokens:
    1. It requires load balancer to persist connections to a single
keystone server by token.
    2. The memory will grow out of control until token_flush is run.
    3. At some point kvs lookups get very slow because there are millions
of keys in the dict.
    4. Process restart invalidates all tokens.

Fixes: bug #1188370
Change-Id: Ic726e12d798b843412158a7b92f5e3e3a654811f
'}]
commit_message:
Using sql as default driver for tokens

kvs driver for tokens is not a production quality storage method.
The shortcomings of using kvs as storage driver for tokens:
    1. It requires load balancer to persist connections to a single
keystone server by token.
    2. The memory will grow out of control until token_flush is run.
    3. At some point kvs lookups get very slow because there are millions
of keys in the dict.
    4. Process restart invalidates all tokens.

Fixes: bug #1188370
Change-Id: Ic726e12d798b843412158a7b92f5e3e3a654811f

commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible except: construct

the deprecated except x,y: construct to except
x as y:, which works with any Python version >= 2.6

Using of locals() for formatting string is a nasty thing because:
1) It is not so clear as using explicit dicts
2) It could produce hidden errors during refactoring

4) Creating a lot of unused variables

Fix bug 1171936

Change-Id: Id6a900899db328be067b8139a49c12ce802dd415

commit_message:
Remove usage of locals() for formatting from cinder.api.*

Using of locals() for formatting string is a nasty thing because:
1) It is not so clear as using explicit dicts
2) It could produce hidden errors during refactoring
3) Changing name of variable causes change in message
4) Creating a lot of unused variables

Fix bug 1171936

Change-Id: Id6a900899db328be067b8139a49c12ce802dd415

commit_message:
Cleanup shell's authentication check.

The original logic for whether shell had enough information to
authenticate a user was confusing and will be very difficult to extend
to other forms of authentication.

Change-Id: I88763a651e494e60070a30f0824505acb09310cb

commit_message:
Add swift::storage::disk to support disk device.

It aim to support to use the disk device as the swift storage backend,
this pathch contains:
    * a new define with three params
    * annotations and examples for this define
    * a new spec test

subject: Clearer registraton LWRP tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-13 05:33:16.000000000', 'files': ['Berksfile.lock', '.gitignore', 'Gemfile.lock', 'Gemfile', 'spec/identity_registration_spec.rb'], 'message': "Clearer registraton LWRP tests

This is a much clearer way to test LWRPs are executed with
the proper options.  The previous approach was hacky, and
relied upon too much stubbing and ruby magik.  Also, updated
to berkshelf 2.0 where Berksfile.lock is respected.  This
is necessary for berkshelf to lock to the proper cookbook
deps in openstack's CI system.

Change-Id: Ia912efffa137a75352423e7571cb74bca9ab1b5d
"}]
commit_message:
Clearer registraton LWRP tests

This is a much clearer way to test LWRPs are executed with
the proper options.  The previous approach was hacky, and
relied upon too much stubbing and ruby magik.  Also, updated
to berkshelf 2.0 where Berksfile.lock is respected.  This
is necessary for berkshelf to lock to the proper cookbook
deps in openstack's CI system.

Change-Id: Ia912efffa137a75352423e7571cb74bca9ab1b5d

    remote.send_file_to('/etc/hosts', hosts_file)

commit_message:
Impl bulk ops for instance interop helper.

* cleanup InstanceInteropHelper class;
* add support for bulk ops using context managers.

For example:

with instance.remote as remote:
    remote.execute_command('hostname')
    remote.send_file_to('/etc/hosts', hosts_file)

Improves blueprint instance-interop-helper

Change-Id: I806c7adad787e669b6f62e5f02494b554ea53bde

commit_message:
Fix _drop_unique_constraint_in_sqlite() function.

We got incorrect unique constrains in function
_drop_unique_constraint_in_sqlite().
New function `_get_unique_constraints_in_sqlite()` was added to fix it.

Change-Id: Iebb4c0e6c3e6a069ba5cde2fdb2a2ff1200b826f
Fixes: bug 1184526

subject: Fix up the test framework
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1207, 'name': 'Duncan Thomas', 'email': 'duncan.thomas@gmail.com', 'username': 'duncan-thomas'}, {'_account_id': 1711, 'name': 'Yun Mao', 'email': 'yunmao@gmail.com', 'username': 'yunmao'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 4159, 'name': 'Cory Stone', 'email': 'corystone@gmail.com', 'username': 'corystone'}, {'_account_id': 4355, 'name': 'Avishay Traeger', 'email': 'avishay@stratoscale.com', 'username': 'avishay-il'}, {'_account_id': 5538, 'name': 'Rushi Agrawal', 'email': 'rushi.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'rushiagr'}, {'_account_id': 5997, 'name': 'Walt', 'display_name': 'Hemna', 'email': 'waboring@hemna.com', 'username': 'walter-boring', 'status': 'SAP'}, {'_account_id': 6969, 'name': 'Michael Kerrin', 'email': 'michael.kerrin@hpe.com', 'username': 'mkerrin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2013-06-14 14:07:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp_nfs.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tools/with_venv.sh', 'cinder/tests/windows/basetestcase.py', 'tools/colorizer.py', 'cinder/tests/integrated/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume_rpcapi.py', 'cinder/test.py', 'run_tests.sh', 'cinder/tests/test_scality.py', '.testr.conf', 'cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix up the test framework

When trying to test a bug the cinder test framework was
running all the tests when I just wanted one to run.

Instead of fixing this problem in nose I tried to move cinder to
testr. I copied a fair bit of code from nova to get this to work.
This way at least if some one makes an improvement to the nova
test framework cinder can improve here also.

Note that now all the tests a thread safe. Added a concurrency argument
to run_tests.sh that defaults to 1. You can specify your own level then
and take the risk of intermittent failures. Tell jenkins to use a
concurrency level of 1 to avoid failing gate jobs.

Note One of these tests is broken and I have disabled for now. There
is a bug for this here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1173266

Note: cinder.api.openstack.FaultWrapper is deprecated and is causing
a circular import when I try and import cinder.tests.test_wsgi. This
is fixed by only importing the openstack.FaultWrapper during the
__init__ phase of the wsgi middleware.

Fixes: bug 1183434
Fixes: bug 1177924

Change-Id: I5e10b55c5b236eb81a6a3e0e9ea56af8ca4ef8e1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix up the test framework

When trying to test a bug the cinder test framework was
running all the tests when I just wanted one to run.

Instead of fixing this problem in nose I tried to move cinder to
testr. I copied a fair bit of code from nova to get this to work.
This way at least if some one makes an improvement to the nova
test framework cinder can improve here also.

Note that now all the tests a thread safe. Added a concurrency argument
to run_tests.sh that defaults to 1. You can specify your own level then
and take the risk of intermittent failures. Tell jenkins to use a
concurrency level of 1 to avoid failing gate jobs.

Note One of these tests is broken and I have disabled for now. There
is a bug for this here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1173266

Note: cinder.api.openstack.FaultWrapper is deprecated and is causing
a circular import when I try and import cinder.tests.test_wsgi. This
is fixed by only importing the openstack.FaultWrapper during the
__init__ phase of the wsgi middleware.

Fixes: bug 1183434
Fixes: bug 1177924

Change-Id: I5e10b55c5b236eb81a6a3e0e9ea56af8ca4ef8e1

commit_message:
Naming instance directory by uuid in VMware Hyper.

Like Libvirt Hyper, Using EC2 template for naming instance
directory may cause conflict. we follow what Libvirt does to use
instance uuid instead of EC2 template naming. To keep backwards
compability, when fails to find a instance by uuid, fall back to use
EC2 name.

Fix bug #1186944

Change-Id: Iaba099225a9b3b0390cae4c5fbd82d7e6c11f0e0

commit_message:
Fix 503 on account/container HEAD w/invalid format.

A HEAD request to /v1/a[/c]?format=%FF would result in a 503 since
there was an unhandled UnicodeDecodeError. Now it doesn't.

bug 1190395

Change-Id: I4d8ec677092617391fe154a25f22d919536a72a5

commit_message:
Enhance the validation of the quotas update

Need check whether the already used and reserved exceeds the new quota
before update it.

DocImpact
Implements a validation to validate whether already used and reserved
quota exceeds the new quota when run 'nova quota-update', it will throw
error if the quota exceeds. This check will be ignored if admin want to
force update when run 'nova quota-update' with additional option
'--force'.
This validation help admin to be aware of whether the quotas are
oversold when they try to update quota and also provide an option
'--force' to allow admin force update the quotas.

Fix bug 1160749

Change-Id: Iba3cee0f0d92cf2e6d64bc83830b0091992d1ee9

subject: Ceilometer may generate wrong format swift url in some situations
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-14 03:11:25.000000000', 'files': ['tests/objectstore/test_swift.py', 'ceilometer/objectstore/swift.py'], 'message': 'Ceilometer may generate wrong format swift url in some situations

Ceilometer uses the admin URL registered in keystone to poll object store.
Usually the url is like: http://<host>:<port>, in some cases, user might
register the url like: http://<host>:<port>/v1
Ceilometer shall get the url registered in keystone and populate it to the
http://<host>:<port>/v1/AUTH_%(tenant_id)s style

Change the url population process the enhance the fault-tolerant capability
of Ceilometer

Change-Id: I3ec6ab0c330e35a2fd6bab36b8a2f43aee883b6d
Fixes: Bug 1183704
'}]
commit_message:
Ceilometer may generate wrong format swift url in some situations

Ceilometer uses the admin URL registered in keystone to poll object store.
Usually the url is like: http://<host>:<port>, in some cases, user might
register the url like: http://<host>:<port>/v1
Ceilometer shall get the url registered in keystone and populate it to the
http://<host>:<port>/v1/AUTH_%(tenant_id)s style

Change the url population process the enhance the fault-tolerant capability
of Ceilometer

Change-Id: I3ec6ab0c330e35a2fd6bab36b8a2f43aee883b6d
Fixes: Bug 1183704

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-06-10 07:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_backend_memcache.py', 'keystone/token/backends/memcache.py'], 'message': "Fix token purging for memcache for user token index.

When issuing a new token, purge all expired tokens from the user's
token index list.

New Options:
* max_compare_and_set_retry:
        The number of retries that will be attempted when performing
        an update of the user_record or the revocation-list record.
        This is relevant due to the use of CAS (compare and set)
        function of the memcache client. This allows for multiple
        keystone processes/wsgi/etc to run without worry of race
        conditions clobbering the lists.

DocImpact - New Options.

Change-Id: I9441105b1e46982b0354bccbf8297daaaa1904b2
Fixes: bug #1171985
"}]
commit_message:
Fix token purging for memcache for user token index.

When issuing a new token, purge all expired tokens from the user's
token index list.

New Options:
* max_compare_and_set_retry:
        The number of retries that will be attempted when performing
        an update of the user_record or the revocation-list record.
        This is relevant due to the use of CAS (compare and set)
        function of the memcache client. This allows for multiple
        keystone processes/wsgi/etc to run without worry of race
        conditions clobbering the lists.

DocImpact - New Options.

Change-Id: I9441105b1e46982b0354bccbf8297daaaa1904b2
Fixes: bug #1171985

commit_message:
Fix ring validate with device prior to rebalance.

A builder file with some devices added but before rebalance() is called
should be invalid (in the sense that validate() raises
RingValidationError instead of TypeError).

Change-Id: I5538239db4b2fde83be2390014504e35ccd7c0d3

subject: Better escaping for GET /v1/a?format=xml.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-14 01:33:12.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/account/test_server.py', 'swift/account/utils.py'], 'message': 'Better escaping for GET /v1/a?format=xml.

Commit 8f9b135 fixed a bug where an XML attribute could have arbitrary
characters jammed into it, resulting in a document with arbitrary
tags... and it did remove the ability to get an arbitrary XML document
out of the object server. However, it left a couple of ways to get a
malformed XML document, one example of which is an account named ".

This fixes up the remaining ways and ensures you always get a
well-formed XML document in the account-listing response. Also, it
adds a unit test for the escaping of the container name; this was
already working, just untested.

If you look in the discussion for bug 1183884, you'll see that the
review comments there are basically "seems good, but could use a unit
test". (The astute reader will note that I am one of the guilty
parties in that review.)

I found this bug while writing the missing unit test.

The moral of this story is left as an exercise for the reader.

Fixes bug 1183884 harder.

Change-Id: I84b24dd930ba1bb6c4f674f8d3996639dedbce15
'}]
commit_message:
Better escaping for GET /v1/a?format=xml.

Commit 8f9b135 fixed a bug where an XML attribute could have arbitrary
characters jammed into it, resulting in a document with arbitrary
tags... and it did remove the ability to get an arbitrary XML document
out of the object server. However, it left a couple of ways to get a
malformed XML document, one example of which is an account named ".

This fixes up the remaining ways and ensures you always get a
well-formed XML document in the account-listing response. Also, it
adds a unit test for the escaping of the container name; this was
already working, just untested.

If you look in the discussion for bug 1183884, you'll see that the
review comments there are basically "seems good, but could use a unit
test". (The astute reader will note that I am one of the guilty
parties in that review.)

I found this bug while writing the missing unit test.

The moral of this story is left as an exercise for the reader.

Fixes bug 1183884 harder.

Change-Id: I84b24dd930ba1bb6c4f674f8d3996639dedbce15

commit_message:
Migrate to stevedore

Use stevedore to load both transport and storage drivers. It will allow
other users to extend Marconi with their own storages / transports more
easily. Stevedore also covers most of the cases around managing plugins.

Change-Id: Ic417c29cef41bdb72c8c446937905509db5ba8cd
